boat.full_description:
Clipper 1 was the first of 5 “Clippers” to be built by Chumley & Hawke at Horning. They were designed by A L Braithwaite to the Metacentric Shelf principle and had a reputation for their performance and speed which was unusual for boats destined for a life of hire.  As with all  sailing craft of this type, her mast is mounted in a tabernacle and she features a lifting cabin roof, which is necesarry to pass under the low bridges of the Broads landscape.

Originally built without an engine, Clipper 1 was fitted with a Stuart Turner engine in the 1960s which is still in use today. Having spent the majority of her life as a hire boat Clipper 1 is still very much how she would have been when originally built.
boat.name: Clipper 1
boat.short_description: Clipper 1 is a 1934 River Cruiser Class gaff sloop. Classic Norfolk Broads sailing boat popular as hire boats in the pre-war era.
